headline.main: House Backs U.S. Radio For Afghans

lead_paragraph: The House voted today to create Radio Free Afghanistan to beam American news and entertainment programs to Afghans in their local languages in an attempt to combat Taliban propaganda. ''Arming citizens with the truth is the best way to bring about change, victory and reduce American casualties,'' Representative Mark Kirk, Republican of Illinois, said on Tuesday during debate in the House that was notable for its lack of criticism of the measure.
abstract: House votes to create Radio Free Afghanistan to beam American news and entertainment programs to Afghans in their local languages in attempt to combat Taliban propaganda; measure goes to Senate where it enjoys some support; State Dept has not been enthusiastic about proposal, preferring instead to beef up Voice of America broadcasts to South Asia for time being (M)
